terminologie_extrait.definition: A defensive strategy that focuses on keeping the ball deep and moving it around to wide angles.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: Used to describe a defensive approach in table tennis.

rope_a_dope_defense.probleme: Struggling to stay in rallies against relentless counter-hitters

debutant.proposition: Attack first and try to end the point before getting into bang-bang rallies.
Force the opponent to open weakly by giving them low, heavy, deep pushes or deep serves that they have trouble attacking, and counter-attacking off their openings with placement key.

intermediaire.proposition: Get every ball back, focusing on confidence and reaction time.
Keep it deep, making sure shots don't go short and get into trouble.
Move the ball around, keeping opponents off balance with wide-angled shots and aggressive counter-shots.

exercices_complementaires.description: Practice getting every ball back, focusing on confidence and reaction time.

metriques_progression.target: Consistency in getting every ball back

erreurs_a_eviter.erreur: Backtracking too much, giving opponents wider angles and more time to attack
